bibl.title: Thomas Allen v. John H. McGraw. Committment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
United States of America.
Territory of Washington, County of King. ss.
To the Sheriff of any Constable and the Keeper of the Jail of said King County: Wheras, At a Justice's Court held at my office in said County for the examination of Thos Allen the said being charged with the crime of Burglary and said examination having been continued until day of 188 and having been adjudged and determined by the Court that there is probable cause to charge Thos Allen defendant herein with the crime of Buglary and that said Thos Allen be held to await the action of the Grand Jury of said King County, and the District Court of the Third Judicial District, holding terms at Seattle, on the first day of the next term thereof, with bail fixed in the sum of 1000 - and, whereas, the said Thos Allen ahas made default in said amount.

Therefore, You, the said John Caldwell are hereby commadned in the name of the United States forthwith to convery and deliver the said Thos Allen to the said Keeper; and you, the said Keeper, are hereby commanded to receive the said into your custody in said jail and him there keep until released by said District Court, or unless said bail be sooner furnished. Dated this 1st day of Feb 1889.
H. F. Jones L. S. Justice of the Peace, Seattle Precinct, King County, Washington Territory
(1057) COMMITMENT Territory of Washington vs. Thos Allen
